column4: hey, does anybody know of a plugin to a mail client that allows you to view .odt documents in it, without having to download and open them in OOo?
there is no such a thing afaik
:-( that's not good.  MS Outlook does that for .doc ... and if we want .odt to compete we need things like that
I was looking through the thunderbird plugins, was hoping someone here heard of it... guess not
ifconfig -a iface
it worked :-) you rock
diff -ur folder1 folder2 ??
ah, the -u may do it
nope....  same output... just says that there is a different file... probably wouldn'y make the kind of patch to create it :-(
no it is -N
diff -Nur folder1 folder2 ??
ah, SWEET
-u is for unified format and r recursive
wow... the N did it... I didn't figure that out from looking at the man page... it's like -N treat absent files as empty... didn't register in my head
thank you :-)
no problem
the router only does port forwarding to the computer gnutella works
ssooo.... there can only be one computer behind it that connects?
it can be the case my home router works that way you can open ports to specific hosts (one by one) but not to all the hosts at once
i can configure it for as much computers as i want though but it is tedious
hhmmmm.  So... I should probably just rig it by turning off one computer, and then restarting the router, so that the other one can get the port?
no, you should check your router configuration and see if the ports gnutella uses are being forwarded to the two computers...
ok, I'll hunt down some documentation on how to do that.  Thanks :-)
no problem
